reviews.text:
The restaurant definitely gets points for its aesthetics ‚Äî the honeycomb-style booths are visually striking and create a cozy, modern atmosphere. Unfortunately, the food didn‚Äôt live up to the setting. I‚Äôve dined at other Kyuramen locations where the dishes tasted noticeably fresher, but this visit fell short.

The pan-fried dumplings were disappointingly mushy, lacking the signature crisp top that usually comes from proper pan frying. The ramen broth was also quite bland until I added cayenne pepper to give it some flavor. Even the ‚ÄúAmazing Lemonade‚Äù didn‚Äôt live up to its name ‚Äî it was underwhelming.

Overall, I‚Äôd recommend stopping by to admire the interior design, but not necessarily for the culinary experience.
Really cute place and great ramen. Would be an awesome date spot!
20 dollars for MID

Enjoyed the food. Fresh and flavourful. Service was quick and efficient.  Loved the design and decor down to the bamboo tables.
Just tried creamy udon, it was amazing!!!
Really good service, super great food. I recommend 100%, thanks to Jess I had the best attention

Ak≈üam yemeƒüi i√ßin tercih ettik. Spicy chilli dumpling (tavuklu), crispy sweet chili wings, japanese french fries (√ºst√ºnde domuz eti ile sipari≈ü ediyorlar), honeycomp platter (5 √ße≈üit aperatifin olduƒüu tabak), popcorn chicken sipari≈ü verdik. En g√ºzeli dumplingti. Crispy sweet chili wings bana √ßok bal aromalƒ± geldi daha acƒ± isterdim. Honeycomp platter almasak da olurdu, popcorn chicken g√ºzeldi ama √ßok iyi diyemem sanƒ±rƒ±m bizim damak zevkimize g√∂re deƒüildi. Ama dumpling √ßok iyiydi bir daha gitsem dumplinglerini sipari≈ü ederim. Ramen deneyemedim. Kapƒ±da sƒ±ra olabiliyor ama kƒ±sa s√ºr√ºyor ve servisleri hƒ±zlƒ±. Atmosferi √ßok g√ºzel

I went out to eat with my cousin and let me tell you the food was immaculate. The servers were very kind and respectful and the service time was speedy. Didn‚Äôt take to long to wait for our food. Overall it was a great experience. So if your looking to go out with friends or even a date night this is a great choice
Delicious black garlic noodles! Love eating in the honeycomb booths too.
Great no frill Ramen spot in Chinatown.
This experience was really good, I have eaten in other places in New York, but this one is the BESTTTTTTT! 100% recommend

The food I had was amazing but the servers definitely ruined my experience. Everything was ok until it was time to pay the bill. I had paid my bill on card and usually I leave a cash tip, which was 100% my intention. This is until a waiter walked up to me as I sat to ask me why didn‚Äôt I tip. This is extremely inappropriate and honestly ruined my time. I no longer wanted to leave my cash tip because this mad me feel extremely uncomfortable and forced which is not okay
It‚Äôs a great restaurant. I love the noodle and the music here!

the food is so amazing like ya don‚Äôt understand how much this food makes me and my girlfriend extremely happy, we come here 5 times a month n they are so quick here never takes longer then 5 minutes for our food and sure it‚Äôs pricey but it‚Äôs well worth the buck for sure 10/10 would definitely recommend, n i did to all my friends and co workers :)
good
Delightful place, good food, nice atmosphere ü•óü•ôüçú
Prefect Ramen!
yummy in my tummy
Very nicely tasted items of food.
Great food. Great environment.

Service was js terrible. There was several times were me and my friend were js uncomfortable. When we order or when we got the check, the server gave us a stank eye and js said okay. Later after we paid and tipped 20%, she blamed it on her being new and that‚Äôs why she didn‚Äôt know how to do stuff properly. I work in the service industry myself, knowing if I was new, I would never give someone that attitude.
Came here on a date and the food was so good! I recommend this place.
Food was great. Gets your real full. ü§©
I really like the restaurant. It has a nice interior and great staff. The food is also excellent highly recommend
Good food good vibes
Me encanta el ramen y de preferencia el lugar y la decoraci√≥n
The food was amazing and the broth for the ramen was so good.
Amazing food for the price great environment and everyone working here is very charming.
üë®üèª‚Äçüç≥üòõ
The food is good and love the ambiance of the place, I always enjoy my meals.

I always go here whenever I want ramen. The ramen here is so good and the soup is very savory. Additionally the food always comes fast and the atmosphere is very welcoming.  Lastly, the food is not too expensive.
So fire. Great food. Lovely area.
The food was amazing. So good ü§©! The inside was gorgeous and great for pictures too!
Amazing food! Definitely will come again!! üòã

The food was amazing. I would
recommend !!
The food was very delicious and for a good price too.
I mean good restaurant, recommend spicy noodle ( sry forgot the full name)
good service and very good food. not super pricey either
Estava muy rico! Pasamos por el Ramen y todo salio rapido y perfecto
It‚Äôs always fresh and tasty

Great Decor,service very good. Food was very good. Very clean atmosphere. Nice waitress.
Only one negative,background music just a touch too loud.
Jess the waitress was great.
Portions are a bit small. Still a bit hungry after the main ramen dish. Restaurant is clean and unique seating. So are staggered against the wall, which is kind of neat aesthetics wise
The service was enough to have me coming back!
Super sch√∂nes Interieur, faire Preise, tolle Auswahl. Und es schmeckt fantastisch.
Great food, average service. love the atmosphere
Estuvimos una semana en New York y ha sido uno de los mejores restaurantes en los que hemos estado, desde que entras hasta que sales. La atenci√≥n y la comida de 10

Was pulled to this place due to the number of amazing meal sets. We personally got set B for two people. Great for couples going on a date. Many options and sensible pricing. Good food! Would come back! Service was exceptional with the host being extremely considerate and the servers being speedy and effective. Broth was generally flavored! Enjoyed it!
It takes half an hour just for lemonade drink unbelievable.

Das Restaurant ist h√ºbsch eingerichtet, vor allem die Kabinen sind besonders. Wir haben an einem normalen Tisch gesessen, was okay war ‚Äì aber leider war die Klimaanlage direkt √ºber uns und es wurde schnell sehr kalt. Wir haben den Kellner freundlich gebeten, uns umzusetzen, da viele Tische frei waren ‚Äì aber das war leider nicht m√∂glich.

Das Essen war super ‚Äì einer der besten Ramen, die ich je gegessen habe! Alles war frisch, lecker und die Portion genau richtig.

Am Ende war das Trinkgeld-Thema etwas unangenehm. Die vorgeschlagenen Summen waren sehr hoch, und als wir weniger gegeben haben, war die Bedienung leider nicht mehr freundlich.

Fazit: Ramen top, Service okay ‚Äì aber nicht flexibel.

Really fun and pleasant atmosphere, and fast service on a Saturday lunchtime. Food was quite good, but not amazing. The music was good Japanese tunes, but talking was easy. I had miso veggie ramen, so maybe the regular ramen is more memorable. My partner rice eel burger, which was very fun and quite tasty, if messy (they even provide disposable gloves to use while eating it).

The food was okay ‚Äî I tried the omurice dish and popcorn chicken, which were decent but nothing standout. However, the ambience really makes up for it! The architecture and interior design are fun and unique, making it a great place to hang out or catch up with friends.

üåü 4/5 stars
Aesthetic, Flavorful, but Service Matters Too

My son and I had lunch at KYURAMEN in Chinatown and were immediately impressed by the honeycomb-style design ‚Äî visually stunning and cozy. The ramen was delicious, rich in flavor, and the skewers were perfectly grilled. We enjoyed the meal.

What really stood out, though, was my son ‚Äî a child ‚Äî noticing the difference in hospitality between the staff members. One male server made us feel like we were intruding, barely acknowledged us, and carried an energy that felt cold and dismissive. Thankfully, a kind and attentive waitress took over. Her warmth and professionalism truly made a difference and saved the experience for us.

A restaurant isn‚Äôt just about good food or decor ‚Äî it‚Äôs also about how people are treated. Tourists, families, locals ‚Äî everyone deserves to feel welcome. We‚Äôd come back because of the food and that one amazing waitress. But I hope the staff is reminded that kindness matters, especially in a city as vibrant as New York.

The Ramen was good but not extraordinary. The service was professional but not friendly or happy. I really like to embrace others cultures, food and language and the team members here did not make me feel like it was appreciated or valued. I will not return.

The place is Japanese authentic style, the quality of food has a good taste of broth and thick texture, the quality of noodles is good
Just the service not really good because its looks like they want us to move quickly
Beautiful and unique restaurant. Service was friendly and food was excellent. I had the curry noodles with fried pork and it was amazing.  Highly recommend.

Fantastic experience at Kyuramen in Chinatown!

We visited on a Sunday evening and were promptly greeted and seated almost immediately. Our server was attentive and took the time to answer all our questions. The restaurant itself has a beautiful, spotless ambiance, and we loved the unique seating concept. Our food arrived quickly, was delicious, and truly exceeded our expectations.

We‚Äôll definitely be back!

Tasty food, nice ambience, and good service. This is a Japanese food joint. It offers fast and pleasant service. I highly recommend the food. We ordered miso ramen in spicy(~ $16), chicken bao(1 piece/pc $4), agedashi tofu (4 Pcs for $11). The spicy is indeed spicy - more like Indian spicy. For Europeans and Americans, I suggest you go with medium level. Chicken bao bun for $4 is a nice 4 pm snack. You can get 2 for ~ $8. Agedashi tofu is nice crispy batter coated deep fried tofu. Tofu is super silky and makes a fabulous pairing with ramen. The best item is their table condiment 'Sauerkraut Pepper'. I know the general ick people have towards condiment containers left on the table. I urge you to brave it and try this. It is a house-made fermented condiment. Pairs beautifully with the baos. Note that eat in moderate as it is very spicy. Our wait time was almost 5 minutes. They give napkins to wipe hands before and after the meal a plus plus. Now about the seating, yes, the honeycomb seating is insta-famous. Personally, I prefer to view the honeycomb seating than sit in it. It looks very pretty, so I chose general seating. Our bill for all above food was about $40 only. This is a place to eat great food on a budget. Highly recommended. Kyuramen - please consider commercializing your 'sauerkraut Pepper' as an independent product.

Service is average (servers are robotic/stoic) and beautiful atmosphere but I just didn‚Äôt like my food.

I ordered the soft shell crab rice burger meal with the Thai iced tea and sweet potatoes fries. The burger was so bland- it wasn‚Äôt even sushi rice it was tasteless white rice for the bun. The sauce was heavy and the crab was completely unseasoned. My first time trying soft shell crab and I asked the waiter will it come completely clean inside. To my surprise the inside had a good amount of yellow stuff known as crab mustard which I didn‚Äôt want. The sweet potato fries/sticks are hot but totally flavorless without any seasonings, didn‚Äôt even taste salt or pepper. The highlight was the Thai iced tea- it wasn‚Äôt sweet which I loved and had a great flavor profile.

My friend however did enjoy the Raman. If I ever come back I‚Äôd get it.

My family and i visited this location 2 weeks ago, i love their pods, it feels so private and i love that we were not next to other people.
The staff were all attentive and very approachable,   We had no specify server, everyone was working together to serve their costumers.

We ordered chicken ramen my picky daughter enjoyed it, we tried the broth and was very flavorful , however the noodles were mediocre , i was expecting for the noodles to be chewy and quality but it wasn‚Äôt id score it 3/5

Beef yakiroti was disappointing  2/5

Scallop scewers was 2/5

Fried chicken rice burger my husband said 3/5

Takoyaki is 4/5 i really enjoyed it

Pan fried gyoza 3.5/5

Shrimp tempura 4/5

Chicken bun was a little too dry for me, although they used chicken thighs, i was expecting a more saucy meat, il give it 2.5/5

Best ramen experience I had in a long while. The restraunt is very clean and organized along with friendly staff that welcome you.

Above anything else I would visit for a great dinner with friends or even yourself since the food is all the glamour. The food tastes as good as the establishment looks. Things just make sense, and for the moment you walk in, your expectations are met. Wonderful broth in the ramen and excellent balanced spice!

Good service and food. Cute design. OK prices to the portion. Entres came out before apertizer!
Deep fried squid tasted good but too much batter and some batter under cooked hence there were lumps of batter inside the squid. Ramen was good, soup was tasty, portion small for the price, pork very thinly sliced but taste good, and corn spoils the ramen experience. Seafood Kamameshi was decent, the shrimp was overcooked and dry, and rice too burnt on the bottom.
Matcha Tiramisu and Japanese Cherry Blossom Jelly was ok. Biggest turn off was serving dessert with take-out plastic spoons!

We had such a great experience at Kyuramen! We started with the bao buns and takoyaki, both were perfectly cooked and packed with flavor. For the main dish, we had the yuzu lemon ramen, and it was incredible‚Äîrefreshing, savory, and comforting all at once. Every bite was delicious, and we left completely stuffed (in the best way!). We were too full to try dessert, but that just gives us a reason to come back. Highly recommend!

Drinks were amazing especially the Amazing Lemonade.  Noodles were not so bad.  We like the selection of appetizers as well.  We found the staff to be extremely friendly and service was great.  Our server Willy was very attentive.  The decor inside was very cute with tables inside little private booths and honeycomb shaped booths.

The pork bao and popcorn chicken is alright. The curry ramen is not our liking. The sapporo ramen is quite good we ate the spiciest one, the kyushu ramen is also good. Not a fan of their dessert specially the matcha pudding. looks very pale and it taste very milky for us (maybe just our taste preferences) we expect to be more in stronger flavor since they do have a matcha ice cream shop too. The sakura raindrop looks ok, but again not as we expected. it is on the hard side of a clear jelly. (but once again, to be fair, maybe because we tasted the softer one because it is does look like a raindrop jelly dessert).
Ps: I love how they gave us small container and utensils and water in kids special cup for our little one to eat without we have to ask. in a lot of other places we usually have to ask for small bowl and kids friendly utensils.

My friend and I came to this place on my birthday. The restaurant was nearly empty in the afternoon, yet no staff was in sight ‚Äî we had to wait before anyone finally showed up. The ramen and omurice were obviously pre-made. I‚Äôm not against pre-made food, but I strongly condemn charging this kind of price for it.

The ramen portion was tiny, and the omurice was a complete disaster. The curry sauce was as thin as water, with no curry flavor at all. It completely ruined the dish.

What‚Äôs most outrageous is the forced gratuity, on top of which I was still expected to leave an extra tip?? Absolutely ridiculous and insane. I will never come back to this place.

Firstly, the interior is incredible, both authentic and modern. There are seats overlooking the open kitchen. And there are places in the form of a honeycomb. The food was fresh and tasty, complemented perfectly by Sapporo beer. The last time I saw such bells with notes was in Tokyo. I recommend visiting.

The food is super good. Recommend the tonkutsu ramen. The ramen is flavorful, and the egg is great. The meat goes perfectly with the tokutsu ramen. Plus the music is relaxing and energetic. The seating looks awesome in little hexagons. The food comes out fast and fresh. Hitting the call button, then the waiters are right at your service. The waiters are fast but don't talk much. There are 2 bathroom stalls and an area where there are drawings to welcome you.

Ordered a basic omurice with demi glace. The food was delivered very quickly though the rice was cold. I would personally prefer the food to be served hot and wait for that. Hopefully this comment helps üòÑ

Very good atmosphere and vibe. I didn't get a honeycomb seat but I still feel like i got the full experience.

The food is very tasty but a good portion of the menu contains pork. The sake is good and requires pacing. You've been warned.

I came to eat here for the first time and  it has such nice decor and atmosphere. The customer service was excellent. The miso ramen was very flavorful and tasty but the small portion was not filling for their high price. Dont be cheap with the pork...3 little thinly sliced pieces of pork! Dessert was so so. Thai iced tea and popcorn chicken was great. Overall, it was a nice experience but I would rather get my money's worth elsewhere.
The food is good and the atmosphere is nice as well. if you want to come here for a nice scenery definitely come here.

The interior of this location is resembles the inside of a beehive. It's quite busy at this place but the food is always great as it has been at the other locations. The Tonkotsu Curry Ramen was more viscous than the Dried Chachu Curry Ramen but still good.

Great experience eating dinner at Kyuramen! We had a great server and the food came out quickly. There are a number of chicken options for non-pork eaters. We enjoyed the sweet potato fries, Ramen dishes, popcorn chicken and dumplings. The flavored jelly shots were delicious as well. Service was awesome!

Sat at the high seats where you can watch them make your ramen (not at a table) since they were pretty packed. We didn‚Äôt mind because we just wanted to get away from the cold.

We each ordered our own bowl of ramen and shared appetizers- fried dumplings and purple sweet potato fries. The presentation of the dumplings was great but don‚Äôt let that fool you. The dumplings were just meh.

The ramen was good. Definitely great on a cold day. Flavor wise‚Ä¶ okay. Had better but also had worse. Spice was good level but prefer spicier. They have hot pepper powders you can add to your food but I didn‚Äôt think they added the appropriate flavors to it. It‚Äôs a cool option though.

Now, let me tell you when I say the sweet potato fries were good‚Ä¶ they were so so so good. We don‚Äôt know what it is because we‚Äôve had it before but that day, it was like what we imagine crack to be. We ordered them 2 more times in that hour. Came hot and crispy and we devoured it. We like normal fries and sweet potato fries, but these purple sweet potato fries‚Ä¶ delicious! I hope we feel the same way when we come back again haha

All in all, come for the food. Not so much the service. A bit slow and somewhat dismissive. Interior is modern and cool with the honeycomb seating.

Give this place a try‚Ä¶ for the purple sweet potato fries! (And a hot bowl of ramen when it‚Äôs cold outside!)

This place has a super vibrant decor that really grabs your attention.‚ùïThere‚Äôs a Matcha green tea shop in front of the restaurant but once you step inside, you‚Äôll find it‚Äôs actually a ramen spot, complete with lava eggs and a chill bar area for hanging out. The service is top-notch, the place is spotless, and the food is absolutely tasty. The ramen noodles strike the perfect balance not too soft, not too hard and the soup isn‚Äôt greasy at all. It‚Äôs definitely high quality. I highly suggest checking out the Chinatown location; the vibe there is just way better than at the other branches.

The vibe is really cool and the food is pretty good. I got the ying yang bowl of Ramen and I'd say it was above average but not the best I've ever had. No complaints though! The octopus balls were good and the Thai tea is top tier for sure. The matcha crepe cake was absolutely wonderful! The service was great. Worth the experience.

We had a disappointing dining experience at your establishment. Despite spending a significant amount of money on our meal, we were subjected to subpar service and an unpleasant encounter with an individual who appeared to be the owner. This person engaged in an argument with us after we settled our bill, which was unexpected and unprofessional. Furthermore, we discovered a hair in one of our guest's food, adding to our dissatisfaction. As a result, we discarded the remaining food. We hope that you will take these concerns into consideration and take appropriate measures to improve the dining experience for future customers.

Great spot for a lovely Ramen. The ambience is amazing and they have these cute honeycomb compartments for a unique experience. The food was tasty. We ordered the fried potato shrimp and Japanese fried oysters from appetizers and both were good. The Ramen was very tasty too. Ended it with matcha crepe cake. There was a lot of waiting after 6pm. The staff did a great job at managing such a huge crowd.

This place was super cute. We had a long wait so I suggest making a reservation. The food came out fast and was very good. We had a hair in the popcorn chicken but it was taken care of with no problems and extremely quickly. There was no kids menu so the babies ordered off the appetizers. It was worth it.
Delicious as always. Book a reservation to get the honeycomb table, it's super cute and adds to the experience. Each plate was delicious and we had an amazing time! Coming back for sure!

Nice decor inside, and good service

The ramen noodles have that sad pre-made texture. The flavor is pretty good though

The pudding is not too sweet, but also not very flavorful.

The pork bun was my favorite.
